Description: A rectangular panel with a raised border, now damaged. There are seven lines of inscription with the traces of incised lines. The inscription is a dedication of a precinct to Poseidon Hippios by Chares, son of Apollonides, the priest, on behalf of Ptolemy V Epiphanes and his queen Cleopatra.
Curator's comments: From the same monument as 1926,0420.1 which has a very similar inscription. For the inscription, Fraser and Rumpf 1952, A, and pl. XIV, above. Bibliography: Fraser, P.M. and Rumpf, A. 1952, 'Two Ptolemaic dedications', Journal of Egyptian Archaeology 38, 65-74.
Associated names: Named in inscription: Ptolemy V Epiphanes
